email.subject: Call for Papers: TOSEM special issue in Agentic AI

special_issue.title: Agentic Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Software
special_issue.journal: ACM Transactions on Software Engineering and Methodology
special_issue.description: A special issue on Agentic AI in Software is planned in TOSEM in 2026, and papers are being solicited for this purpose. AI has had significant impact in SE affecting various branches in Software Engineering (SE) including coding, testing, analysis, patching, documentation, and even design. Lately with the arrival of Large Language Model (LLM) agents – the discipline of SE has seen further shifts. The autonomous deployment of tools with LLM backends gives the agents tremendous power and potential in bringing greater automation to SE tasks. At the same time, greater automation in SE tasks does not immediately mean greater productivity gains. There exists a lot of concerns around trust in the output produced by agents and the amount of manual effort needed to integrate agent workflows into software engineering workflows. Further, a software engineer's creativity is not only from their own thought - but can be triggered by interactions among team members or from feedback given in a team meeting.

topics.description: Automation of SE tasks via agents
Integration of agents into existing software workflows
Agent – human interaction in SE teams and team dynamics
Any other agent in SE topics not covered in the preceding list
